detaileddescription.para:
compositor
The libweston compositor where to enable.
This enables the weston_debug_v1 Wayland protocol extension which any client can use to get debug messages from the compositor.
WARNING: This feature should not be used in production. If a client provides a file descriptor that blocks writes, it will block the whole compositor indefinitely.
There is no control on which client is allowed to subscribe to debug messages. Any and all clients are allowed.
The debug extension is disabled by default, and once enabled, cannot be disabled again.

briefdescription.para: Determine if the debug protocol has been enabled.

parameterdescription.para: The libweston compositor to verify if debug protocol has been enabled

memberdef.argsstring: (struct weston_log_context *log_ctx, const char *name, const char *description, weston_log_scope_cb new_subscription, weston_log_scope_cb destroy_subscription, void *user_data)
memberdef.name: weston_log_ctx_add_log_scope

memberdef.argsstring: (struct weston_compositor *compositor, const char *name, const char *description, weston_log_scope_cb new_subscription, weston_log_scope_cb destroy_subscription, void *user_data)
memberdef.name: weston_compositor_add_log_scope

briefdescription.para: Write a formatted string for a subscription.

detaileddescription.para:
sub
The subscription to write for; may be NULL, in which case nothing will be written.
fmt
Printf-style format string and arguments.
Writes to formatted string to the stream that created the subscription.

briefdescription.para: Close the stream's complete callback if one was installed/created.
Destroy a file type or a flight-rec type subscriber.

detaileddescription.para: They are created, respectively, with weston_log_subscriber_create_log() and weston_log_subscriber_create_flight_rec()
Creates a subscription which is used to subscribe the subscriber to the scope scope_name.

If scope_name has already been created (using weston_log_ctx_add_log_scope or weston_compositor_add_log_scope) the subscription will take place immediately, otherwise we store the subscription into a pending list. See also weston_log_ctx_add_log_scope() and weston_compositor_add_log_scope()

parameterdescription.para: the log context, used for accessing pending list
the subscriber, which has to be created before
the scope name. In case the scope is not created we temporarily store the subscription in the pending list.

briefdescription.para: Creates a file type of subscriber.

parameterdescription.para: if specified, used for writing data to

simplesect.para: a weston_log_subscriber object or NULL in case of failure

briefdescription.para: Create a flight recorder type of subscriber.

detaileddescription.para: Allocates both the flight recorder and the underlying ring buffer. Use weston_log_subscriber_destroy() to clean-up.

parameterdescription.para: specify the maximum size (in bytes) of the backing storage for the flight recorder

simplesect.para: a weston_log_subscriber object or NULL in case of failure

briefdescription.para: Iterate over all subscriptions in a scope.

detaileddescription.para:
scope
the scope for which you want to iterate
sub_iter
the iterator, use NULL to start from the 'head'
the next subscription from the log scope
This is (quite) useful when 'log_scope' and 'log_subscription' are opaque. Do note that sub_iter needs to be NULL-initialized before calling this function.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve flight recorder ring buffer contents, could be useful when implementing an assert()-like wrapper.

detaileddescription.para:
file
a FILE type already opened. Can also pass stderr/stdout under gdb if the program is loaded into memory.
Uses the global exposed weston_primary_flight_recorder_ring_buffer.
